parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pleres and phoreo; to carry out fully, i.e. Completely assure, entirely accomplish.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
Probably from the base of ginosko; the intellect, i.e. Mind; by implication, meaning.
